intro: Trachycaryon cunninghamii var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth trachycaryon, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Australia. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its morphology includes narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers that may be white or pale in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
